text: Draft. A brown beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of alcohol, over ripe fruits and a bit of spice. The flavor is acidic with notes of fruits, wood, and alcohol, leading to a tart finish.

[9149-20170420] 375mL bottle. Light fruit and sour dark chocolate tannins aroma. Hazy, dark deep red body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Sour funky fruit flavour. Medium body is very sour. Interesting. (8/3/8/4/14) 3.7
(Crooked Stave Tap Takeover @ Birreria Volo, Toronto, ON)

Pours deep ruby tinged mahogany into a snifter. White head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Sweet cherry and oak aromas. Tart with cherry and red grape upfront turning to dry oak in the lasting finish.
Draft from Bodega in Short North: Ruby red pour. Tart dark fruit, vinegar. Wine vibe, moderate pucker. Dry, oaky. Good, like fruited versions better tho.
The Sovereign DC: pours reddish brown with a small head. Aroma is vinous, woody, fruity. Taste is sweet and slightly sour. Very winy and woody. Good sour red.

Appearance: hazy/opaque deep amber with a short, short-lived creamy ivory head, patchy lacing. (3/5) Aroma: vinous, oak, leather, dark fruit. (9/10) Taste: moderate-high tart, moderate sweet, low bitter. (8/10) Palate: medium body, lively to moderate carbonation, drying tart and warming finish. (4/5)

Something a little special for this, the 2500th unique beer I have a record of rating. Prior to this, the only Crooked Stave offerings Id been able to locate were collabs with Epic and Evil Twin. This is a good example of a Flanders Brown, if slightly more emphatically tart on the tongue than typical for authentic versions. (16/20)

8/10 #ryansbooze ryansbooze.com

Mega intensywna czerwień, wręcz brąz. Jestem w stanie uwierzyć, że to burgund, choć na moje jest to jeszcze ciemniejszy kolor. Wysokie wysycenie (pojawił się nawet nieznaczny gushing przy otwieraniu), ale podczas degustacji nie przeszkadza. Piana niewysoka, przyzwoita. Wyśmienity Flanders. Owoce, przejrzałe wiśnie. Kwaśność konkretna, jeszcze niewykrzywiająca, choć na mój gust bliżej górnej granicy normy. Winne. Fajna cierpkość przechodząca w goryczkę. Lekko octowe. Na swoją moc i ciało, pijalne. Dla mnie bomba.

Pours deep red/brown, minimal head, no lacing. Malt, sour, and wine nose. Nice balance of malt sweetness with sour, subtle wine, earth. Nice finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2017-04-20. Dark brown body with a modest tan head. 3+ Aroma has light funk and a bit of a tang to it, moderate malt has subtle nuances Im not putting adequate descriptions to. 7+ Flavour is lightly sour throughout, light lactic undertones, whispers of fruit and vinous touches. Smooth average bodied palate, soft carbonation. Solid but not enticing me back. 8/3-4/7/3/16 Bottled at Birreria Volo, Toronto.

Nice Flanders. Not too sourish not too sweet, just perfectly balanced. Ready, woody and slightly vinous, leather and cherries notes. After warming up quite noticeable Brett character. Semi-dry to dry, moderately sour. In overall really nice more to the vinous and acetic than malty.

Tap at RnH East. Dark ruby color, small steady beige head and lace. Aroma is Flamish red aleish, tart with red wine tannines. Light-bodied. Very tart, lots of mouthpuckering red wine tannines. A bit of wood and earthyness. Dry. Not really my kind of sour brew.
Smells very tart. Brown. Kinda sweet tart. Tasted at my "numbers and names" bottle share.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Origins (Burgundy Sour) by Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project at Saska KępaFlandersowe. Chleb, sliwka, susz, drewniane klimaty, ciut octu ale fajnego, w uscie sporo i kwasnosci i slodyczy, duzo co2, pod koniec bretyOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Oak from cork to vanilla, sour cherries, very light leathery funk, chocolate and light high lactic sour connect sufficiently, unbalanced tho.

From notes. Enjoyed at a tasting at Corbets house on December 21. 375 mL bottle. The pour is a hazy reddish brown color with a thin light egg shell colored head and a couple spots of lace as it falls. The aroma is very vinegary and boozy. There is a bit of malt and sweet caramel before a strong lactic sour takes over. The flavor is much of the same. Its really dry, vinegar-heavy, and carries a strong maltiness to it. The mouth feel is a little syrupy and softly carbonated with a somewhat creamy feel and a lingeringly acidic and alcohol finish. This just isnt my jam.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Wyśmienity Flanders Oud Bruin.
Sampel butelki w BrewDog Warszawa. Aromat owocowy, skórzany, lekko octowy. Smak średnio kwaśny, wytrawny, lekko cierpki. W smaku dużo owoców ciemnych, głównie wytrawnych wiśni.

On tap @ Chucks CD. Pours clear thin reddish brown with very thin white head. Aroma is big rich tart cherrries, leather, and dry toasted oak barrels. Taste is likewise - a touch brighter and fruitier. Plenty sour without being a huge puckerer. Rich and delicious.

Sampler at Liquor Express. Pours brown with a thin brown head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Lots of wood and fruit on the nose. Tons of tartness and wood and fruit on the tongue. What lovely, fresh, bracing beer.

Draught. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Dark re amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy very sour aroma. Moderate bitter wonderfull sour flavor. Great balance and power. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Excellent.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pour is deep brownish red with a small off white head. Aroma has cherries, vanilla, slight Dark malts, light cola, light cheesy. Taste is sour, again cheesy, funky dry, light oaky finish. High carbonation and a medium oily body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are rich red fruits, citrus, malt, leatherand has a nice sour fruity finish.

Tap. Pours light hazy reddish dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aromas of vinegar, malt, caramel, cherries, balsamico. Taste is vinegary, lactic, balsamico, caramel, sweet malt, cherries, currants.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus, shared with RasmusOtt. Aroma of acidic, light fruity, oaky. Hazy reddish brown with off-white head, mostly diminishing. Taste is dry, moderate- sour, light bitter. Medium body, oily/dry feel and acidic oak finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours dark unclear brown with an off white head. Aroma of oak, balsamic, lactic tartness, vinous notes and slight vinegar. Taste is tart with notes of vinegar, balsamic, oak, tart green apples and slight black currants.
CBC2015, Pours brown with a small head, aroma of fruits, vinegar, dried fruits, flavor is sour with, lemon, cherry, dried fruits, medium bodied, very nice

375ml bottle pours out a cola color topped with a fizzy head. Nose is nice berries tart sweet big fruit barrel notes and a chocolate. Taste is more of the berries barrel presents is big vanilla and chocolate.
Bottled:Deep red with a small head.Sour aroma of red currants, cherries and grapefruit.Really sour taste with winter apples, oak casks and lots of grapefruit.
Draught @ The Diamond. Murky dark brown with small frothy off-white head, grape-oak aroma, low carbonation, acidic grape taste with some oak, thin body, long tart finish. Very strong barrel effect.

375 mL bottle. Brown in color with an average khaki head. Aroma is of chocolate, berry, tart, cocoa, plum, and wood. Taste is of tart raspberry, boysenberry, dark malts, chocolate, dried cherries, and wood.

Bottle. The look is a tan head, dark brown cola colored, clear. The smell is blackberry, tons of fruit, super berry like, wood, tang, and tart. The taste is great, fruit, tart, grapes, wine, and good stuff.
Very dark amber in colour. Puckeringly sour. Clean crisp sourness. Vinous. Enjoyable.

Tap at Copenhagen Beer Festival in Boston (9-24-2016) showing cloudy brown with a light white foam. 

The nose shows a light mix of cherries, oak, and brett. 

The palate is light bodied and well carbonated. Lightly tart with flavors of light oak and brett.

A 375ml bottle from batch #5, bottled in May 2015, and poured into a Cantillon ballon glass. It poured a clear but dark burgundy reddish brown colour with a one finger beige head that had decent retention and left spotty lacing. Aromas full of fruity grape, red wine, blackberries and cherries. Lightly tart with hints of oak. Tastes sour and tart, fruity grape, cherry and red wine with a touch of lemon, oak and vanilla. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall nice, balanced and easy to drink.
Mahogany with little head. Aroma vinous, slightly vinegar. Taste is very fruity, almost juicy, cherry, medium sour, slight bitterness, slight spice. Man, this is great

375ml bottle. Medium beige head atop hazy garnet body. Aroma is moderately sweet, vinous, sour, some wood, light lemon, raspberry, funk. Taste is medium sweet, lemon sour/vinous, some wood, funk. Effervescent, acidic medium body.

375ml bottle.
Pours a clear mahogany brown, with a thin beige head.
Complex, well developed aroma, brett, oak, very vinous, dark fruit, vanilla, cherries, caramel, coffee, toasted notes, cinnamon, blackberries.
Bone dry, medium body, low bitterness, balanced CO2.
The taste reflects the aroma to the max. Extremely complex, well balanced, with a very clean acidity that lingers on the palate. Ridiculously drinkable, easily one of the best non-Belgian sours I have ever had. (2016-09-03)

Creamy sour? Yes with barrel. Sour tang. Very strong tang. But nothing that is astonishing. At the brewery thin fading head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown colour smallish head on top. Aroma has red berries, lactose and bread like malts. Taste is sour with red berries, milk chocolate and some roasted malts. Medium body and medium carbonation.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Pours a dark brown-amber with light tan head. A decent tart fruit and malt aroma. A powerful tasty fruit taste of raspberries, cherries, and other dark fruits with some dry yeast. A lingering tart and dry yeast aftertaste.
Bottle at home. Pours deep orange amber, nose is funky, wood, berries, taste is dry, sour, chewy, light fruit.

Bottle, shared by myself, in the library... just now! 
Pours a deep reddish brown color with a big head right off the bat that fades reasonably quickly into a small head with minimal lacing on the glass.

The aroma is really something, oaky with tart cherries and some nice earthy funkiness. Very low on acetic aroma with some plum and pear. 

The flavor is really quite sour, I mean within the boundaries of acceptable sourness, but on the high end of that scale. Lots of tart cherry flavor, plenty of oakiness, and a huge lemony component with a hint of balsamic vinegar. Gracious the lemon flavor is happening here. Its very dry and very low on bitterness.

good stuff, not something Id like a whole lot of but very nice.

Pours dark unclear amber like Hennessy. Aroma brings darker malts combine with the sour yeast and some of the burgundy grape. Flavor brings tart plum like flavors and the burgundy barrel creeping in and taking over.

Bottle. Pours ruby red with fizzy white head dissipating to a persistent ring. Smell of brett, bread, cherry candy, red grapes, purple grapes, red wine. Sparkling carb. Taste of grape soda, lemon. Just right tartness. Great mouthfeel.

I love all things funky and sour, and this didnt disappoint. There are some cherry and tart apple flavors from the malt and the yeast, and its a little oily with a long finish and lively carbonation. However, the funk to sour ratio leans heavily towards the sour, and it hits you hard with some vinegary puckering. Solid sour -- just bring some Tums.

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Hazy dark brown in colour with a very thin white head. It has a sour red fruity and spicy, zesty tart fruit flavour followed by an oak, vanilla sour cherry finish. Good!

37.5 bottle from The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey. It pours a clean ruby copper color with minimal beige head that disappears immediately. Aroma is tangy lactic zesty acidic with notes of lemon juice and tart red berries. Lightly vinous. Taste is also tart acidic with more lemon and vinous notes. Light bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, tasty sour

Amber with off white head - Malt aroma with some sourness and hints of berries - Malt body with a good sourness that has some berry flavours - The sourness goes into a long finish - This was real good

375ml bottle. Clear chestnut colour with ruby red glimmer and small to average, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Mildly vinous, oaky aroma, hints of blue grapes, red and dark berries. Taste is tart, fruity, dry oaky, tangy, notes of grapes, red and dark berries, corresponding vinegar; slightly biting sourness, reinforced by carbonation with "subtle liveliness", lasting finish.

Aroma is fruity, wooden, mildly floral and brett like funkiness. Flavour is wood, some sourness, tart berries as well as some sweet maltiness to it.

37cl bottle. Gusher. Pours a deep burgundy red, with visible carbonation and a beige head with no retention. Smells of red grapes and wine, dark fruit, prunes, raisins, caramel and quite a bit of oak. Sour and very rich in flavour, with notes of unripe grapes, red currant, gooseberries and a very feint but perfectly integrated caramel background. Very nice.
Bottle. From notes mid 2015. Taste is flemish; red grape, leather, cherry, oak, slight vanilla light lemon. It has vanilla and floral note. Very enjoyable but lacking a little sharpness.

From bottle brought back from Oregon. Pours a dark, almost opaque mahogany. Nose is just a hint of cherries and other dark fruit, definitely lets you know its a sour. Taste is sour apples and cherries, oak. Im a big fan!

Vinous. Wooden notes. Very sour. Cranberry. Smooth dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark mahogany pour. Forced some white bubbles to form, but no head. No lacing. Brett funk and coffee notes. Some dark fruit. Thin malty taste with a big acetic bite. Tart and sour.
KRS 101015. Red dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is sourness, berries, roasted malt, caramel. flavour is sourness, berries, roasted malt, caramel, funk, nuts. Very nice beer.

On tap at CBC15. Reddish brown with off white head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruit, sour notes, cherry and smooth acetic notes. Taste is sweetish, acetic, sour, nicely balanced, some sweet caramel notes, malt, lemon and red berries.

May 2, 2015. On tap at CBC2015, red session.
Cloudy brown with a frothy off-white head. Aroma is sour and fruity with cherries, raspberries, citrus, grapes, some sweet toffee notes, oak and vinegar.Taste is acidic fruity and light sweet. Finish is dry with oak, apple skins, sour lemon, cherries, apple and vinegar, sweet toffee and dried fruits. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.

Bottle at Andys for sour beer and board game Saturday. Pours a somewhat clear brown with a thin white head lacing around the edges. Wood and caramel on the nose, soft acid. Medium bodied, tart and tangy, big long acid with some aged strawberries coming through, soft balsamic. Lingering wood and acid on the finish.

Une rouge/brune Des Flandres ne laissant peu ou pas de traces ni de mousse sur le verre. Claire, rougeoyante et vive, cette bière laisse échapper très peu darômes. Une cerise griotte bien aigre, un bois vieilli mais somme toute une trop faible complexité aromatique. Cest en bouche que la bière joue ses atouts. Dune aigreur intense, les saveurs boisées et fruitées se révèlent. Lattaque est très pétillante et la suite bien sèche. Des saveurs de baies rouges surettes. Aucune amertume, corps mince, la bière se boit tout de même très bien!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

375, cap. Pours a crystal clear dark brown with no head or lace. Bright Jammy, tangy, berry like nose. Watery still body. Beautiful bracing jam berries, tart fruit, biting oak, and piercing ferment acidity. Long tangy dry finish. Wonderful beer.

(Crooked Stave Origins) Waxed bottle 375ml from a trade with sunnrider, thanks! Served into a teku, ABV 6.5%
Deep mahogany brown colour on the body, with beautiful red ruby shades where light crosses it. Small thin tan head on top, with average retention.
Aroma of grapes, red wine, light sour notes and funk.
Quite sour taste, with grapes, red wine, wood, funkiness, nice!
Medium thin body, low carbonation.
Very good!
Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Tart cherry, vinegar, oak aromas. Tart sour flavors, cherry, oak, light balsamic tones, very acetic and sour.
burgundy pour as advertised. looks a little flat but carbonation is ok. smell and flavor are great - wine, oak, berries, quite tart though not over the top. very pleasant.
Bottle. Pours deep red/brown with a beige head. Aroma of Brett, lacto, dark berries, woody, tart, light vomit, quite complex. Taste is rather sour, berries, rather dry, wood. Nice

Kochsgade Friday afternoon tasting in November. Red brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruit, cherry and a light balsamic vinegar. Sweetish and vinegar sour flavour with caramel, vinegar, a little lemon juice and sour cherries
Bottle @ Orla, Bickle and Dolle goes bananaz. Pours Hazy amber with a creamy head. Red Wine, Wood, lacto, berries and caramel. Sippable stuff.

(375ml Batch 5 May 2015 bottle from kihoskh.dk) Pours a very dark mahogany brown with a moderate, rapidly fading off white head and lace. Aroma of sour berries, red wine, oak, vanilla, light toast, a bit of balsamic vinegar, caramel core and a touch of funk. Flavour is heavily acidic with notes of lemon, sour berries, crab apple, red wine vinegar. Nutty roast notes and oak on the finish, light vanilla. A bit of barnyard funk. Lingering acid, especially lacto, in the aftertaste. Lightish body with slightly higher than average carbonation. I find this one a bit too high on the acid vs. malt on the palate, making it a tough one to drink compared to some in the style and robbing it of complexity. Came across as surprisingly lactic for the style. Decent, not amazing.

Poured from a 375ml bottle. The aroma is tart, berries, sweet malts, chocolate, light acetic character. The flavor has a stronger acetic character, but it is not out of place or distracting to this beer. There are more berry notes and chocolate. This is a lovely beer, just lovely.

Bottle. Darker amber in color with an off-white head. Sour red fruityness, notes wooden vanilla and funkyness in aroma. Mild cellar earthyness to it as well. Quite dry with some red wine vibes in taste beneath those sour fruity and sweet wooden vibes. Oak and barnyard in finish. Nice one.

Bottle. An unclear, dark brown beer topped by a small, dense, dark beige head. The aroma is subtle but pleasant, with dark sour berries, some roasted malt notes and caramel and a funky barnyard touch. Its sourish and berryish in the mouth, with some nutty hints, roasted malts and caramel hints. Some oaked tannin notes. Full body and a pleasant, low level of carbonation. Lasting finish. Rather lovely this one, tasteful and moreish. 151010

Bottle. Pours brown with an off-white head. Aroma of sour berries, caramel, red wine, funk and malt. Flavor is sour and tart with some berries, red wine , acid and malt. Medium body, average carbonation.
From tap at CBC 2015. Hazy red-brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of berries, vinegar, oak, caramel, funk and malt.
@ Stordirren 15-9-8: rätt trevlig doft. Smaken är syrlig med toner av fat, socker och knäck. Fin lång eftersmak.

Bottle. Dark chestnut brown with a medium sized beige head. Sour nose; lemon, wood, light barnyard. Flavour is pretty nice. Oak, leather, balsamic, lemon, tobacco, earth, dark cherries, raspberries. Medium body, light sweet, heavy lactic sour. The sourness is too heavy for me and the finish is like lemon. So I like the way it tastes, but to me this is overly sour and not very drinkable.
Bottle. Darker opaque amber maroon pour with a fairly quickly fading head. Awesome tart dark fruit / cherry all over this. Bright prickly on the tongue. Killer beer.

Draft at the brewery. Batch 5. Pours opaque nut brown with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like sour fruits, tart apple, fermenting cherries, yeast. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet cherry, raisins, tart apple, and yeast.
Picke dup this bottle in portland. Pours cola like brown, slim tan head. Mildly gunky nose. Taste has puckering sour, mild oak, lemons. Acid burn is pretty painful. Light body.

Dark brown pour with a tan head. The aroma is full of a lot of tart, dark fruit notes with some leather, light brown sugar and oak. The flavor is similar with the dark fruit and grape notes adding a nice amount of sourness. There are also a lot of heavy oak tannins. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

CBC 2015. Pours red brown and thin with almost no head. Aromas of red apple, red currant, citrus, funk and gooseberry. Taste is red apple, red currant, funk, citrus and gooseberry. Mouthfeel is tart and dry with medium carbonation.

Crooked Stave Tasting Night; hazy mahogany red pour thin tan head, aroma has dark cherries, some figs, taste has a Demerara sugar, some dark cherries, a hint of chocolate, some vinous action, very tart but nice.

Im not a huge fan of this style but this one isnt bad. Its cloudy red brown in the glass w/ a foamy head. It has a tart cherry nose which is vibrant and bright. Its tart and just a little sweet, maybe a touch on the heavy side. Theres some toasty malt to play of the fruity acidity and works pretty well. This is medium bodied w/ medium carbonation, decently drinkable. Definitely, fans of this style should check this out.
Bottle 5/15 batch 5. Pours a mahogany red color with a khaki tight sudsy film. Aroma is sour tart woody funky. Taste is very sour fruit and wood funky oak tannins. Palate is medium slick and dry.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a clear dark ruby color with a small white head. A big fresh fruity cherry oak nose. The flavor is oak, more sweet cherries, sour lactic notes, sharp at times, sawdust. Quite nice. Lively palate. Quite sour, more than some of the traditional Flemish red/browns.

So good. Pours brown, murky with no head or lacing. Nose is tart. Flavours of cherries, sour candy, some plums, dark grapes. Taste med/big tart, med sweet. Full sticky body with light carbonation and a huge lasting sour in the mouth. Really nice.
Tap at Crooked Stave. Pours dark brown with almost no head. Really tart aroma. Taste follows, very similar to La Folie. Awesome stuff.
backlog. standard flemish brown. Vinegar nose, sour oak notes. Very nicely done.

375 ml bottle. Batch #4. 11/2014. Courtesy of tiong. Thanks so much!
Reddish brown color with a tiny off-white head. Sourness, red berries, brett, some sweetness and some darkness in the aroma. 
The flavor is sour... really sour... with red berries, tartness and dryness. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375ml bottle
Bottled 11/2014 Batch 4 - Pours dark reddish brown with a small bubbly head. Aroma of berries, tartness, some funky yeast, sourness, oak and wood. Taste is woody, oaky and heavy with berries and mild sourness. Finish is sweetish, woody, oaky and funky with loads of berries, some sourness, oak, wood and vinous notes. Interesting, quite heavy on berries and sweetness.

On draught at the brewery, this pours clear brownish-prune into the glass with a light soapy head that leaves trace suds lacing. The nose is of unripened berries and stone fruit. Under-ripened cherries, blackberries and cranberries hit a lingering sour finish. The palate is extremely complex, lively and juicy, and makes for a hugely successful wild sour noir!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to glass. Pours a dirty brown olive color with a light tan head. Aroma is a bit faint, but has a nice tartness, acetic acid. Flavor is potently sour, balsamic vinegar. Sour, sticky mouthfeel. Awesome beer.

Sour fruity aroma and taste, acidic, grapes, light vinegar, berry fruits, funky, light floral and grassy, tart on the palate, dry tart finish.
Clear dark amber brown body with a thin beige head. Aroma is a bit woody, a bit of wine, tarty berries. Taste is sour and tangy. Sour finish, medium dry. Really nice.

375 ml bottle, 11/2014, from Craft Bier Fest Linz.
Dark copper, brownish body, with a small, sparkling, dissipating, beige head.
Delicious aroma of oak, vanilla, sweet and sour berries, apples, funk, subtle vinegar.
Taste is fresh, sour, dry, tart, with oak, barnyard, sour berries, sour and sweet apples, wine, ripe fruits, some vanilla, subtle leather.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a soft carbonaton.
Finishes smooth, medium sour, quite dry, also a bit sweet, fruity, wooden, slightly leathery.

Tasty! Very fresh, with a quite strong, but well balanced sourness and lovely oak notes. Drinks surprisingly easy. Enjoyed the diverse, complex nose even a bit more though. Overall among the best beers of this style Ive had so far, really pleasant.
CBC. Dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, yeast, baking yeast, sour fruit, caramel and wood. Flavour is malt, yeast, dark fruits, sour fruits, caramel, little sour and a little acid.
Bottle. Brown body with white head. Aroma is red fruits some wood hints of sourness. Taste is also sour, dry, some wood and hints of sour red fruits. Aftertaste is dry and sour. Very nice.
Bottle. Dark brown with off white head. Aroma of Flanders funk, spicy, peppery. Taste of spicy funk, oak. Slightly sour.
CBC. Hazy brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, wood and sour fruit. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 020515

[5/2/15] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015. 3rd session. Amber-brown. Aroma is funky, cellary, fruity, with vinegar. Sour flavor, funky, fruity, cellary, a bit vinous, with vinegar. Great stuff.
Tap 2 CBC 2015. Brown with a beige head. Aroma medium sour (fruity, grapes, figs, grapefruit, vinegar). Flavor medium sour, fruity, woody notes. Light body, nice.

Dark browning color with red hints. Slightly woody nose with hints of what seems like wine. Big tart taste. As the beer warmed up a bit and coated the glass more, it went from being a good beer to a great beer. If I had another bottle, Id make sure to swirl it around the glass a few times before drinking.

Draught @ CBC 2015, Red Session, København

Bottle pour. Very deep dark red color with a light white head. Very sharp aroma, harsh on the nose. Bitter hoppy taste, more than I expected considering it's a sour. Not very oaky. Overall and okay sour.
Pours mahogonny with an off white lacing. Aromas of oak, cheese caramel and barnyard.

A: Mild Brownish Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Apricots, Hay, Mild Sour Mash

T: Apricots, Sour Mash

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Bitter

Overall, not a bad burgundy sour but not much else beyond it though unfortauntely.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2015 On tap at The Source. Brown and hazy with a tan head. Sour and tart, light red wine aroma and flavor. Nice pucker.  Update: Small bottle shared last night.  Just as good as it was on tap, a little pricey though.  Fruity, juicy and lightly vinous, always good!
Sampled at esbls. A very active head disappears quickly. Red brown. A funky aroma with fruit and malts. Tart. Yeast is funky and wild. Fruit is dark. Big malts. Not bad at all.

pours reddish amber, with thin head. More carbonated than expected, but in a good way. Nose is sour cherries, with grape juice, plum and raisin. Flavor is awesome, I could drink this all night. Sour tart cherries and grape juice with well balanced oakyness. The finish sits on your tongue for hours making your mouth water for more of that tart cherry flavor..

Small snifter at the brewery. Pours deep, dark red. Aroma is dark cherry, the most tasteful bourbon barrel, malt vinegar and something almost like chocolate, perhaps from the barrel melding with the fruity notes. Its puckering in the flavor, no doubt powerfully sour. Rich notes of black cherry, perfect bourbon flavors and strong vinaigrette complexity. Honestly one of the best sours Ive had in a while.

On tap at Crooked Stave. Pours a dark, blood, red. Nice light head that slowy disappears. Aroma of funk, cherries, plums, grapes, and acid. Very balanced sour, and tart, but not mouthpuckering. Smooth. No vinegar or astringent flavor. Very, very, very good.

Bottle. Deep brown with a thin layer of soapy white head. 

Thin mouthfeel. Taste of oak, barrel char, moldy blackberry and very sour cherry.

Bottle shared by Dave. Aroma is sour grape, lemon peel and oak. Pours bronze and hazy with a small head. Taste is ultra tart grape up front but quickly fades in taste. Plum and oak remain but no real taste presence. Mild mannered.

Bottle. Very pretty clear red pour with thin white head. Grape must, dark cherries, very nice, light balsamic, raspberry, light sesame oil. Taste is a bit biting, quite acidic, fruity acidity, acetic, very dry. Palate is well carbed, dry. Very good.

Bottle 375ml. Thx Tom10101
Pours brown with low beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of fruits, sourness, ketchup. Taste is of fruits (intense), sourness, acid, ketchup, berries. Palate: Light-medium body. Overall: Pretty good. A bit harsh on acid.

Bottle (375 ml). As Burgundy Origins. From Os, thanks! Deep burgundy/amber with a medium fully lasting off-white head and some lacing. Aroma is of ketchup at first, followed by red fruits, oak, vanilla, tannic notes and light caramel. Taste is slightly sweet and amazingly complex with red fruits, oak, caramel, light ketchup, acidic notes, vinous notes and vanilla. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Vinous mouthfeel. Slightly dry. Super example of the style. Really complex. Balance is nearly perfect, especially for the taste. Not too acetic. Nice fruitiness. Really drinkable.

Bottle from Scott - thanks! Murky, rusty brown pour with a slick of tan foam. Red wine, light brett, oak, and heavier tart in the aroma. Taste is fairly sour with a sharp red wine flavor followed by lemon and tart, light grain, and a lingering sour bitterness. Clean and dry. Very nice sour.

On tap @ Beachwood BBQ. Pours very dark brown with a small tan head. Chocolate, oak, and light roast on the nose. Some grass, lemon peel, dark fruit, and red wine vinegar. The flavor is kind of watery. Cocoa, roasted malt, grass, and lemon peel. Light red wine vinegar, some oak, and dark fruit.

P: Almost completly black with some dark purple highlights and no head just a few bubbles that are floating around. S: Oak and burgundy penatrate the nose, along with some black currants. T: So unique, dark fruits (plums and blackberries), burgundy, oak, grapes, and some sweet dark cherries. Nothing is to harsh and it all blends very well. M: Thin and light carbonation it ends with a dry puckery finish. O: Fantastic stuff.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured a clear reddish brown color with an average frothy tan head with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy sour tannic fruit, yeast and wood aroma. Medium to full body and a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy sour flavor with a medium to heavy sour finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout complex beer.

Bottle, thanks tim, pours a dark amber/reddish, aroma is funky, flavour is a nice strong sour a bit woody and the flavour is really nice sour, with a good finish, one of the nicest flemish sour beers ive had.
12oz bottle at my place with group. Pours light beige. Aroma is brown sour amazing. Taste is amazing sour. Finish long sour tart and great. Mouthfeel is light crisp.

Bottle thanks to adnielsen ! Pours a rusty brown with a finger of eggshell foam. The nose is tobacco, leather, a little diaper funk and deep cherry vinous notes. The palate opens beautifully with great vinous fruit and balanced acidity. Great mouthfeel with a smooth dry finish.

375 ml bottle shared by brew3crew. Pours a slightly hazy amber brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have tart fruit, wood, red grapes, tannins, some acidity, mild caramel sweetness with some lactic sourness as well. Lighter body, but a solid drinker.

Bottle from doodler shared by deyholla; thanks guys! Pours clean dark amber with a cream head that dissipates. Nose is tart fruits, a bit of cheese funk and an oaky base. Taste is same w tartness driving the the trailing oak.

Bottle thanks to the Dood! Pours a hazy deep amber with a tan head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of oak and dry red wine with a nice backing sour berry note that has a touch of acid. Flavor is similar with rich sour berries that are backed by a light oak note and just a touch of dryness.

Bottle at "Ölkalas hos Ekne".

Light brownish with a small head. Quite sour with red berries, wood, some vinegar, some fruit and light brett. Nicely drinkable.

A- opaque amber brown pour with a quickly dissipating 1/2 finger of light tan head. S- brown sugar, faint molasses, sour bing cherries, some funk, sulfur, light leather, damp oak, musty white grapes, lemon juice. M- quick, medium acidic palate with a mild to medium body with good carbonation. T- tart cherries and lemons to start but it dies off quickly. Brown sugar supports. Vinegar in the middle that lasts through a quick ending. Some unripe green grapes and mineral water in the middle as well. Ending is grape tannins, lemon and vinegar. Simple taste, but not to a fault. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375 ml bottle from my 2013 Membership. Thanks for the assist, Aaron. Pours a nice brownish copper pour, darker reddish glow, well hazed body with some glowing ruby copper edges and bottom. A frothy tannish head dies to a decent filmy layer, sticks around as a loose film, laces ok. Aromas show tart cherries, balsamic, and a bit of biscuit. Firm oak presence, red wine, a bit of acidity. Good bigger oak, gentle brett grows, a bit funky, some of that toasty biscuity malt base shows a bit. Initial is firm lactic sourness, nothing offensive, nothing acedic. A bit dry lactic sourness shows cherry, red wine, yogurt. Sour and smaller body up front and as we move on. Really kinda nice. Not potent and acedic, but nicely sour, still showing some decent base quality. Middle is a bit dry and tannic, moving on into firm oak, a touch of vanilla, earth, gentle red wine feels. Red grapes come on stronger here and moving forward. Backend shows a bit of spiciness, gentle red wine, and vanilla. Really, oak and lactic elements are firm, more red grape are a touch juicy, tart, and tannic. A smaller body makes this a touch thin overall. But really, quite drinkable. A touch of fuzziness on the palate, big lactic element shows a touch of raspberry, pulpy berry in there somewhere. Really quite clean, cherry fruit, big oak, a bit winey,n with a big lactic presence without being acedic or offensive, no Balsamic or vinergarette feel in the slightest. Its not all that complex, but it is quite tasty. Nose could use a touch more. But this is really a nice quite crushable sour.

375ml bottle... Pours a reddish brown consistency with a thin soapy light beige head... Aroma of soured seedy berry, softer cherry, earthy pits. Light basement quality. Bretty dust and grapes? Perhaps... Flavors are more oud bruin focused, somewhat intensely sour. Medium bodied with semi-lively carbonation.

Bottle. Pours with a hazy, deep amber brown with an off-white head with good retention and lace. Aromas are of oak, caramelization, coconut, lactone, vanilla, dark fruit, dates, leather, honey biscuits. Damp wood and red wine. Flavors are medium acidic, nutty, earthy, currant, oaky, mild brett. Sawdust lactones. Very cleanly acidic. Mildly leathery. Mild acetic. Fuller carbonation, medium body, puckering and tannic dry finish. Reminds me a bit of what young La Folie use to taste like when it was corked and caged.

Bottle, 06/21/2013. Pours deep mahogany, ruby highlights, thin fizzy white head, cohesive ring of lacing around the glass. Aroma is vanilla, tart berries with lactic barnyard funk and mild vinegar, musty caramel, oak. Taste is quite tart and lactic, tangy red berries and sherbet, nutty wood quality. Medium body, puckering, which slowly grows on you. Nice.

Bottle, many thanks to Bill! It pours cloudy deep red-brown with a medium off-white head. The nose is tangy, sour berry... raspberry, cherry, bitter-sweet aspect, vinegar, wood, faint vanilla and coconut. The taste is tangy fruit, tart cherry, raspberry, high level of tartness, sherbet, lemon, Granny Smith apple, wood, mild acidity and vinous notes with a dry, rather tart finish. Medium body, fine carbonation and velvety mouth-feel. Very nice level of tartness and excellent balance. Delicious!

Pour on tap at the brewery, dark orange-red pour with thin off white head, aroma brought nice oak, lactic notes going into some red fruits, slight toffee, caramel notes with a nice grassy, funky note, mixing with a slight spice note.  Taste is nice, sweet red fruits and caramel mix into a heavy oak, spice, and tart lemon notes, touch of earth, finishing with more oak, sour fruits, and a slight bitter funky note.  Nice stuff.

375-ml bottle. Beautiful understated aroma of wet leather, lactic acid, horse blanket, and a touch of dark stone fruit. Pours a dark mahogany brown with a soapy head. Nice melange of light balsamic vinegar, raspberry, slight tannins, and lactic funk. The flavors mesh well without a dominant tone. Very carbonated, which helps create a prickly, acidic mouthfeel. Lightly dry, soapy finish. I need more!

Bottle @ Bruces. The pours ruddy brownish red with a small head. The aromas or brown sugar. Red berry. Soft acetic sourness. The taste is nice biting tartness, mild brett. Woody tang. Red grapes. A bit of terrys chocolate orange. Medium body, fine carbonation. Overall, quite nice.

17th May 2013Tasting at Bruces pad. Thanks again to Bill and Paul for the tag team here. Hazy deep reddish amber beer, little pale tan head. Light crispy palate, dry. Thin creamy malt. Nice winey sourness and tangy red berry fruits. Again a slight Flemish red vibe here. Semi dry finish.

375ml bottle, thanks Aaron.  Pours a deep, reddish brown color with a tan head that fades to some bubbles around the glass.  Aroma is earthy, yeast, oak, a little nutty.  Medium on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is sour, oak, vanilla, nutty, earthy, grassy, with a light sour finish.  A nice sour brown ale.  Needs just a touch more sweetness to balance it out.

Thanks Chad. Not a fan of Oud Bruin style but this was different. Cherries, vanilla, banana and oak. Smelled sweet and fruity. finishes with a tart aftertaste that really lingers for a while. Stoked to be getting more of these.

Bottle at Bruces, London. Big thanks to the back of Bills car, and to Paul. Pours deep amber with a creamy, tan head. Nose suggests hefty sourness, some sweat and vinegar. Strong but balanced sourness in the flavor, moderate sweetness, some dried berries. Light bodied with fine to average, massaging carbonation. Clean finish, some dry berries, good fruity tang, light acidity, light funk. Really nice.

shared by clonies (brad) .. . quite foamy .. . orange peel, sour hay, and toast .. . light linger . .. a bit thin .. . last bottle of the day .. . . hey paul- dont be a greedy fuck, cuz wigan won the fa cup

(375ml bottle)  Pours an amber body with a small off-white head.  Aroma of caramel, red grapes, cherries, horse blanket, subtle leather, and wood.  Flavor of toffee, cherries, raisins, red plums, sour apple, caramel, and oak.

Pours reddish brown with nice medium off white head and sporadic lacing. Aromas and taste of cherry funk, oak barrel, saison yeast, super tart, horse, and lightly acidic fruits. Medium body. Lots of complexity here. Top notch sour ale from America.

Pours brown with low off-white head. Aroma of cherries, grapes, apples. Taste is very balanced sour with a light sweet touch. Body is light with average, refreshing carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Burgundy, sour oak barrels, yeast, dark fruits on the nose. Follows to the taste, complex with spiciness on the palate, dark fruit again, impeccable blend. Plus it's waxed! I'm really liking Crooked Stave these days.
Reddish brown pour, tan head.  Flavors of red wine, balsamic, tart cherries, some raisiny notes sneak in.  Tasty!

375ml bottle, shared by brew3crew. My pour was towards the end part of the bottle. Pretty hazy brown color, kind of amber. Thin light khaki head, good spread of lace. Dark fruit, kind of oaky. Smooth, light carbonation, kind of creamy. Nice lighter tart taste. Good stuff

Waxed bottle to snifter (anks brew3crew). Looks good; a cloudy brown with thin off-white lacing. Smells and tastes good too; tart with notes of malt and funk. Nice and lively on the palate. Good beer!

On tap at Churchkey during CBC week.  Pours a translucent, mahogany amber with very little white head.  Big, sour, Flanders nose, prunes, bitter greens, red wine vinegar, slightly vinous, apple cider.  Flavor of sour apple, vinegar, malt, a little bread.  Big, tart finish.  Full and acetic.  Nice Flanders.
Bottle at Churchkey shared with Chris, Geoff, Greg, Keith. Clear deep maroon color, almost flat. Aroma of sourdough brownies, plums, raisins. Taste is soft sour, roasty, dark fruit. Very nice.

Huge thanks to Bill for picking these up for me.  Served in my new Crooked Stave tulip, also courtesy of Bill.  Mild malt and toast notes in the nose behind lactic acid character. Faint earthiness. No malt character in flavor. Mild fruit. Very nice.
Pours hazy mahogany with light tan shell.  Aroma is cherry, vinegar, wood.  Taste is sour and sweet.  Tasty.

From the bottle, brown pour with tannish head.  Oak and sour notes in the nose.  Tart, fruit and sour flavor.   Good stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 7, 2013 The beer is hazy and light brown with a small head. The aroma brings oak, sour tones, barrels. Smells nice tastes nice. Like a Flanders oud bruin. The amber base is a nice change of pace. A bit of cherry with moderate sourness and pleasant barrel character. Acetic finish with some lip smacking goodness. Crooked Stave is churning out some tasty stuff these days. Recommended.

Bottle (I think) at Churchkey for the Craft Brewers Conference. Poured a dark ruby color with a off-white head. Aroma was some serious nice sour, tart notes - fruits. Flavor was nice barrel, red wine notes. Plenty of lactic notes. This was great - highly drinkable and highly enjoyable. Ill be on the lookout for this one again. Really liked this one.
dark sepia, thin large bubbled cream head. Acetic nose has brown sugar, light copper. Acetic, thin-green flavor early, light earth mid, caramel and vine notes with dry finish, slick finish.

375mL poured at Churchkey for CBC. Pours a deep haze ruby looking dark brown in the glass. Medium tan foam. Nose is excellent Flemish red/oud brune (my favorite style): cinnamon, red wine, flank steak, fat, muted bourbon barrel, mild acetic spice (good for style), light vanilla. Spot on. Taste is also spot on like Oerbier Reserva: cranberry, tannic berry skins/red wine, bright acid, lactic lime. Vinous, fresh. Easy to love. Fantastic for style.

Tulip 30 cl. draft at the Crooked Stave Barrel Cellar in Denver, Colorado.  The pour is clear brown ruby with a white head.  The aroma is initially acidic, though that clear pretty quick revealing red grape wine, additional tart cherry, and some additional general funkiness.  The taste is approachable sour acidic fruit, balanced with general red grape, and then shows some lightly sweet maltiness that wasnt present in the nose.  The palate is light to medium bodied, prickly carbonation, and a acidic sour dry finish.  The carbonation and sour make this really easy to drink.  Nicely done beer.
Pours a hazy brown. Oak and fruity aroma with a hint of funk. Moderate sourness is rounded by some sweeter malt and raisin qualities. Light body with just a bit of carbonation. A great sour.

Unique burgundy aged red. Dry, with plenty of complexity.
Color is tobacco-y red. Aroma is funky yeast, deep red wine.
Taste is full bodied, burgundy infused sour! Imagine that.
Very, very good.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2014 Re-rate, batch #3. Tap at the brewery. Clear dark ruby brown with a thin beige head that lasts on the sides. Aromas of  sour apple, Bing cherries, funk, wood, and light spice. Flavor is sour apple and cherry front with some funk, wood and just a hint of chocolate underneath. Light to medium bodied, dry finish with a lingering sour apple/cherry.

Tap @ Crooked Stave. Per the new guy at the tap room, this is the same as Origins and should be aliased. Pours a clear brown appearance with a small disappearing tan head. Raspberry, vinegar, oaky, a bit funky, grape aroma. Nice mouth feel. Tart but not overbearing. Black cherry, dark grape, somewhat vinous, fairly tart flavor. Nice stuff!

On tap at Crooked Stave. Poured a beautiful ruby color with small white head in to a CS snifter. 

Nose is light with dark fruit notes and vinous aromas as it warms. It has light fruited flavors of strawberry, cherry and zin fruit grapes, along with some oakiness on the finish. Mouthfeel is soft and sessionable. for a wild ale / sour... 

This was very balanced and light on the sour characteristic I expected would grab me. Could drink dangerous amounts of this. =)

The CS gang told me it was aged for 12 to 18 months on wood and made from a blend of batches Chad had been saving for this project. 

Also told it will likely be bottled - so get some. Good stuff.

On tap at Crooked Stave poured a clear reddish brown with a small lingering tan head. Aromas of tobacco, red grapes,horseblanket, light toffee and light citrus. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of tobacco, toffee, citrushorsebl;anket and light red grape with a crisp dry tart lingering tobacco finish.

Tap at the barrel cellar - hazy dark red - almost completely still - nose is lightly acidic, with sweeter notes of peach, pear, apricot - slick mouthfeel - low carbonation - moderate acidity, with sweet peach and apricot underneath - lightly funky fruit skins and bitter pits late - subtle but complex - aside from the almost non-existant carbonation, this is a winner.

On tap at the Barrel Cellar. Pour is deep hazy brown with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Funk, vinegar, raspberries, lacto, spice, peach, oak, and tart fruits in the aroma. Taste is raspberries, blackberries, wood, white wine, green apples, brett, light caramel, and a touch of roast on the backend and a medium sour finish. Light body with medium carbonation. Well balanced but pretty damn sour. Nice!
